page.title: 19ATTITUDES, WARLEY: ANALYSIS
page.content: The interviews show that the people of Warley generally consider the block to be a{pleasant}place to live in: many think that it is friendly, clean and to have good shopping facilities. Many consider that it has some{rural characteristics, responding to the phrases such as parks, green and leafy and green belt. Equally, however, it has the{suburban}characteristics of London too: commuting, high car ownership, lots of traffic, high house prices and a growing population. Most of these interviews were carried out in a shopping precinct opposite the Ford Offices in Warley, however, and it may be that many of those interviewed also worked there, which could have affected the results: the area may thus appear to be relatively more affluent than it actually is.
